column5: message

Pass undefined onWheel handler to avoid registering active listener when not needed (#1114)

In the case that the XYPlot is used without an onWheel callback the code was registering a listener anyway. This would cause warnings in the chrome console about registering an active listener.

The warning will still be shown in the case that an onWheel callback is set, but this change prevents the listener from being registered when it is a no-op anyway.

Fixes RadarChart axes (#796) (#842)

The RadarChart axes does not show or is displayed incorrectly
(ex. wrong number of ticks) depending on what the startingAngle is.
Rotating your graph a certain degree can cause these problems,
because JavaScript's trigonometric functions (ex. Math.sin & Math.cos)
can return numbers with floating point errors, ex. sin(pi) is zero. But
JavaScript may return a floating point number very close to zero which
can cause calculation errors to occur in displaying axes.


Merge pull request #121 from uber/better-margins

Allow the user to apply margin as a single value or as a partial object

Big update for grid lines:
- Updated the API of grid lines: support the same one, that is used in the new Axis (`tickValues` and `tickTotal`);
- Eliminate the use of d3-axis: all grids are now rendered using React.
- Renamed the `orientation` property of the axes to `position` (makes more sense, doesn't overlap with the grid's orientation anymore).
- Performed minor updates.
Add the new type of animation for the axis (work is still in progress)

Do not recreate the domain each time when the scale is passed.

The parent picks up the domain from all values that are being passed **and** passes this domain for the children. It helps to reduce the excessive computation of the values, eliminates the use of `_allData` array and helps to run the components separately from the parent.

Merge pull request #122 from uber/fix-duplicate-axis-values

Fix the duplicate axis values

Fix the duplicate axis values

Previously the axis values were duplicated due to the bad formatting of the labels ('1, 1, 2, 2' were shown instead of '1, 1.5, 2, 2.5'). This change fixed the axis

Allow the user to apply margin as a single value or as a partial object

- Now you no longer need to pass an object with all sides (e.g. `left`, `right`, `top` and `bottom`): partial objects such as `{left: 1000}` are accepted.
- The defaults are applied on top of the margins.
- The user is allowed to pass a number for all margins instead of an object (will be applied to all sides).

Previous decision of having external custom fonts in the library was questionable. External fonts are removed from the library and applied in examples only. The user may define his own fonts in the body of the document and the fonts will be picked up well.

- Click handler was added to the series.
- All event listeners are moved to AbstractSeries to avoid code duplication.
- Event listeners for area series are fixes (didn't work previously).

Merge pull request #50 from uber-common/bugfix/bulyonov-fix-ordinal-scale-single-value

Fix the category chart when only one value exists
Restrict dev dependencies' versions to something feasible.

Fix the category chart when only one value exists

In case if only 1 value existed in the chart, the ordinal scale wasn't rendered properly: the calculation of the distance between the chart's columns was broken.
This fix adds an additional check for the domain: if the chart has only one value, uses the entire range is used as a distance.

Merge pull request #44 from uber-common/bugfix/bulyonov-0-height-bars

Fix 0 height bars

Fix 0 height bars

0 height bars were caused not by the incorrect calculation of height, but by the wrong calculation of the bar width, when distance NaN instead of a real number. This small change fixes the calculation of distance (e.g. bar width) for the case when the first distance is the shortest.

Merge pull request #20 from uber-common/feature/bulyonov-remove-display-name

Avoid using static getters for displayName.

Avoid using static getters for displayName.
`static get displayName` produces breaking interference with livereactload. Currently `displayName` property is attached to the class after the class is created.
**Note: This should be changed in future, when static properties will come out of the Babel's stage-0**
